item.description:
Abu, the photographer, is going to take some group photos for you.
The problem is, he always commands people to make gestures by his order. You better do what he wants or he will get impatient and mad!

OK, Chume, Boom! is a real-time dexterity game with both cooperation and competition modes. Each round player(s) must perform specific gestures following the icons on the revealed tokens. If someone fails, they won't score points and Abu will get angry little by little. Try hard to follow Abu's orders and become the best photo actor!

Welcome to the Dress Up Show! You must change the colors of your outfits as fast as possible to match the assigned missions and score points. Some costumes have special colors and patterns. Can you beat the other players to be crowned the Dressing King/Queen?

In What to Wear? players use their colored plastic cards to match the colors and patterns shown on each mission card. Some missions require a bit knowledge of color mixing and reasoning. Get some practice and you may become the master of colors!

Fast-paced, head-to-head or solo baseball action on your tabletop! All-Star Lineup Baseball captures the feel of professional baseball, without the need for extra charts or a thick instruction manual.

The game includes a gorgeous 14x24 playmat, big league player cards for 4 World Series teams, a set of custom dice, and more. Player cards use statistics from actual big league players, and past seasons are available, both in Post-Season (10 team) and Full Season sets.

—description from the publisher

TTMC is a mix of party and trivia games. Self-assess your knowledge from 1 to 10 on a variety of uncommon, interesting and random themes!

Be the first to reach the final card by answering the questions you chose. Each team will self-assess itself from 1 to 10 on a multitude of topics. Each grade has a more or less complex question: the higher the grade, the more difficult the question. If you answer it right, the team will go up the number of boxes corresponding to their self-rated score. For example, if you answer correctly question 6, you will advance 6 boxes.

It's funny, accessible to everyone and there is plenty to play with: 540 cards and 4.019 questions, with the added value of original cards to spice up the game.

So how do you self-assess in Aladdin? ... in imaginary animals? ... in toothpicks?

—description from the publisher

name.value: Knowing Me, Knowing You Card Game

item.description:
The Knowing Me Knowing You Game from Purple Donkey tests how well you really know your friends. With this scenario game you have to correctly guess your partners reaction to 5 different scenarios. Suitable for four or more players, this fun game includes 50 scenario cards, 10 wild cards and 24 answer cards. - A.D.

Key Features:

Knowing Me Knowing You Game
Tests how well you really know your friends
Includes: 50 scenario cards, 10 wild cards and 24 answer cards
Suitable for 4 or more players

—description from the publisher

Lethal Skies is a tactical game of air combat between modern fighter jets. In Lethal Skies each player controls two or more aircraft in fast paced dogfights. This book provides the basic rules framework needed to play Lethal Skies. Rules for individual aircraft, their traits and weapon systems are available separately.

The theme of this game is based on the famous book by Robert Louis Stevenson, where he tells the story of the good Dr. Jekyll, who drank a mysterious potion that turned him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

Each player has 8 characters Jekyll / Hyde. All figures show on the front Dr. Jekyll, but on the back are 4 really Dr. Jekyll and 4 are instead Mr. Hyde.

These true identities remain unknown to the enemy until the characters are captured.

There are 3 different goals:
conquer the 4 Dr. Jekyll figures of the opponent
lose your own 4 Mr. Hyde figures
escape with your own Dr. Jekyll figure through an exit in a corner of the opposite side of the board

How does the game start?
Each player takes 8 pieces of one color and then places them on the board as shown in Figure 1, with the names directed to the player and the unnamed part (or Dr. Jekyll) to the opponent. Place the pieces carefully so that the enemy does not see the true identity of the pieces.

Now you play alternately by moving one character forwards, backwards or sideways - never diagonally. If you move through a field occupied by the opponent, this figure is hit.

To win, one of the following conditions must be met:
conquer all 4 opposing Dr. Jekyll figures
lose all 4 of your own Mr. Hyde characters
leave with your own Dr. Jekyll figure in a corner on the opposite side of the field

Spiky Dastards has 5 little figures that are so cute, you'll want to capture them all. But be careful, they're well protected! Split the deck of 60 cards into 2 piles and reveal the top card from each. The pictures on the cards will indicate 1 or 2 of the figures that players must race to carefully grab. If you're able to grab one, you get a card. If you grab the wrong one, you lose a card. You'll have to be daring if you want to collect the most cards and win!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
North Africa 40 CE

The Numidians were conquered by the Romans during one of their civil wars . The new governor appointed officials to plan roads connecting as many towns and cities as possible. They wanted long straight roads crossing rich farmlands to transport food to the population with a surplus for export.

Spread out your town and city tiles on a 8 x 8 squares board, to make roads which connect together to form one network, through as many open squares as possible.

Numidia allows you to play as co-operative or competitive game. The social atmosphere is diferent but the rules are the same.

NUMIDIA IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

Roman Empire 1 CE

Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken in the entire Roman world. This was to aid military conscription and tax collection. Everyone was summoned to their home town to register and be counted. For many this involved a long and difficult trip. Luckily, they were able to gain encouragement and support from others making the journey.

Use both your own and the other players’ people so that your
people can race home by moving as often as possible each turn.
Move your people tiles forward on a 8 x 8 square board depending on the numbers on the tiles in line with the last tile that moved. A skillful player can get a large number of moves on his turn by moving a low number tile first and aligning the successive tiles well.

SUMMONS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

name.value: Debacle: Dutch East Indies and Malaya 1941-42

item.description:
Abstracted land, sea, and air game. 9-day turns, so a normal 8Dec41-6Mar42game is 10 turns, although the game can be shortened by an even earlier Japanese victory or lengthened by a stubborn, crafty Allied/ABDA defense.

Individual battleships and carriers, otherwise usually 2-cruiser, 4-destroyer and 6-transport divisions, air squadrons, and regiment or brigade size land units. As in Desert Campaign for tanks, air-to-air combat determined by aircraft type matrix - not factors. Also, a simple but elegant ground combat system enabling the attacker to risk greater losses to win.

Unknown Dutch secret airfields and secondary Dutch ground unit strengths aid solitaire playability. Concealed (until contacted/exposed) and dummy units for deception and bluffing.

—description from the publisher

A mind-warping race against the clock! Solve puzzles, riddles, and secret codes to PROVE your wits - on a brilliant maze-like game board that opens in 16 different ways.

Includes over 300 challenging puzzles, codes, and riddles for you to solve, with difficulty ranging from extremely easy to brain-melting. Land on a green space, and answer a simple brain teaser. Land on a red space… and prepare for your mind to implode!

The AMAZED board can unfold into infinite* configurations, ensuring that each game is a completely brand new experience. Pick a starting place, choose your route, and roll the die. Move left, right, up, down, or even warp across the board!


 Okay, it’s actually 16 ways. But it feels super infinite, I promise!


—description from the publisher

item.description:
In the trick-taking game Beutelschneider, players compete to gather as much gold as they can, but the gold is on the lowest-valued cards in the game, so you can rarely win with your own gold and instead need to grab it from others.

The deck includes 36 cards in four colors, as well as nine trump cards in a fifth color. On a turn, someone leads a card, and players must follow suit if possible. For each Beutelschneider (cutpurse) you collect, you must subtract 20 points from your score for the round, which could put you in the red; the Beutelschneider is the highest ranked card in each of the non-trump suits, though, so ideally it will allow you to collect the 10-point gold sacks that rank far above the cards worth 1-4 coins.

Many of the trump cards in Beutelschneider have special powers, and the deck even includes a bunch of violet special cards that can be added to gameplay if desired. To do this, shuffle the deck of special cards separately, then give each player one before dealing out the other cards like normal.

item.description:
If you are reading this then fate has found you. 
My voice in this text is from the year 3045. What you are reading on your screen is a simulation of possible change in what ever time you may find yourself in. This simulation is a meditative practice of change for our Aina(land) and Uhane(spirit). A change that that I dare say has gone to the worst in the time I am from.

We call this simulation Huli.

Huli, was created with several goals in mind, to teach our keiki’s (children) the importance of land stewardship, of reminding our elders that it is never too late to change your narrative, and finally to act as a guide and pathway for alternate timelines.

In Huli, you will take the mantle of one of these Avatars, KONOHIKI: The Steward of the Ahupua’a, KUMU: THE Steward of Knowledge, MAHI’AI: The Steward of Cultivation, and LAWAI’A: The Steward of the Sea.

Your goal is to practice removing all Eha (hurt) from the landscape through time.

—description from the designer
Players in Qwantum need to enter numbers in their personal grid that always go higher within a particular color — well, until those totals need to go lower once again...

item.description: In Alle gegen Rudi, everyone is trying to catch Rudi the mouse, who runs faster than everyone else, but if the team plays smart, they can still beat him in the end.
In La-La-Laut, a.k.a. Li-La-Loud, you have the find the balance between being too loud and too quiet, with the fox moving to the right target only if you're making sound at the right volume.

GET LOOT! is a 2-5 player competitive hacking game where your goal is to exfiltrate (steal) loot while sabotaging your rivals with strategic crypto-locks and Hak5 themed cyber attacks!

Win by being the first with 5 unlocked loot cards.

Each turn you may Exfiltrate or Attack, then you may Lock or Unlock.

Exfiltrate: Take the top loot card from the loot draw stack. If it is locked, you must take the lock with it.

Attack:Follow the instructions on the attack card, then discard and draw a new one.

Lock: You can lock one loot card in your stash, or the top card from the loot draw stack if it's unlocked.

Unlock: Remove a lock from one loot card in your stash if it matches your key's suit. Return lock to inventory.

An interactive assembly adventure game Boxitale mini assembly adventure game uses a smartphone/tablet to stream an original animated story.

The story is full of challenges that need to be solved using Boxitale's special connectors and rods.

Once built, the result is uploaded into the story.

Mystery Date Catfished is an adult party version of the classic Mystery Date board game that many people remember from their childhood.

This game brings you into dating in the digital age. By picking, swapping, and collecting the trait cards and action cards, you'll wade through a sea of weirdos as you search for love in the dubious world of online dating. Once it's time to open the door on the game board, prepare to meet the companion of your dreams and your dating scenario. But watch out! You just might get catfished instead!

—description from the publisher

Heavily revised new edition

It is the aim of the game to find out the 
secret wishes a game master has chosen. An ice cream and a crown? Or maybe the plane and the heart? These things are depicted on cards. With three cards each, the game master puts a series - and then reveals how often his wishes are to be found in it. Further card series each with a hint do follow. Which agent solves the riddle first?

item.description:
Revised reissue.

You are dwarves and find a chest. Hastily you divide 
the treasures on four heaps. Actually, it's worth to wait, because the treasure heaps are getting bigger in the game. But maybe a dwarf grabs your favorite treasure and when it gets really thick, the cave ork might catch you!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
As a natural scientist you observe the animals and flowers in the 
area of Mount Memo. You lay landscape cards over each other and let a card mountain grow steadily. How many toucans are already sitting on the mountain? How many whales swim in the water? And what is that? A green sparrow sailing in a hat? Shoot your photos at the right moment and win real pebbles!

Anarchess takes place in the land of Chess long before the enemy White and Black kingdoms were formed. Back when the land was not ruled by kings and queens, neither structured armies with bishops, knights and rooks existed. The world was unexplored and amorphous and it had not been squeezed yet into the rigid cast of the contemporary chessboard. There were just 2 proud tribes constantly struggling to expand their territories to ensure survival in a barren and harsh land. And those who today we (somewhat degradingly) call "pawns," were free entities with dreams, fears and hopes who defined their own destiny.

The game is played with 32 light- (‘white’) and 32 dark-colored (‘black’) square tiles and 8 light- (‘white’) and 8 dark-colored (‘black’) pawns.

As players on their turn need to randomly pick a tile, there are 2 options:
(a) Place the tiles in a bag.
(b) Before playing, players flip a coin (tails = white tile, head = black tile) or, roll a dice (1/3/5 = white tile and 2/4/6 = black tile).

—description from the designer

item.description:
Biff! is a lighthearted, quick-fire, take-that boxing game for 2-6 players. Easy to learn, easy to play and ultra-portable – Biff! will have you bopping and blocking your way to becoming the ultimate Biffing Champion!

Outwit your opponent with your mind, brawn and moves until they can no longer respond and win the round. The player with the most points after 12 rounds win the game!

Each player shuffles their deck and draws 2 cards. In turns, play a card from your hand into 'the ring' (according to the card chart) and draw a card. If you can't play a card you're knocked out of the round.

-description from designer

Objection Overruled is a quick-fire, take-that courtroom battle game for 2 players.

Easy to learn, fun to play and ultra-portable – Objection Overruled pits you as two corrupt lawyers arguing high-profile court cases before Judge and Jury.

More concerned with winning than the truth; you must bamboozle the Judge with science and facts to “prove” your version of events. And if that doesn’t work, throw in some dodgy evidence, bribes and lies to cheat your way to victory.

Justice is overrated.

Each player shuffles their deck and draws 2 cards. In turns, you must play a card and draw a card - mounting up evidence to discredit your opponent and win the case. If you can't respond according to the card chart you loose the case and move on to the next trial.
First player to win 5 case makes partner and wins the game.

For an extra challenge, you can use the "Lawyers never lie" rules: where you can play evidence cards face down. Get caught lying, or falsely accuse someone of doing it, and you'll loose the round.

—description from the publisher

Fantasy Pug Quest is a non-collectible card game for 1-5 players which lasts about 30-45 minutes for Heroes of age 10+ which will have to cooperate in order to defend their worlds from the conquest of the evil forces menacing them.

Fantasy Pug Quest is inspired by the heroic atmospheres belonging to the first Dungeon & Dragons edition and on tactical combats from JRPG like the very first episodes of Final Fantasy: the will to cooperate and the fraternity spirit which usually bonds adventurers are the main basis of our project!

The players, the brave good-doers pugs struggling to bring peace among the animal races, will have to fight Monster and their Bosses in order to free the Worlds they live in, adapt to their rules, gather Energy to perform incredible Combos, pick up Treasures and share with their party in order to maximize their power and finally save the day!

HOW THE GAME WORKS:
A game of Fantasy Pug Quest is fast and easy!
Starting from the youngest player and continuing clockwise, every player chooses an Hero Ability Card and the corresponding Hero Character Cards are placed on the Gaming Area starting from the Hero with the lowest Initiative value.

Then every player draws as many Energy Cards as shown by the table and a World Card is revealed in order to know which special rules will apply to this game: the World Card also determines where the Monsters will spawn on the Gaming Area.

Everything is ready for the fight and the creature with the highest Initiative value starts the first Turn of the first Round of combat. â€¨Heroes use their Energy Cards to perform as many Combos as they want during their Turns (chosen from those available from their Hero Ability Card); moreover they can perform up to 2 Actions chosen among: Move, Attack, Draw, Discard. The same Action can be performed more than once.

Monsters follow the rules written on their own Cards: one random player will move them and make them perform their attacks during their Turns by simply following such rules.

Are you afraid it is too hard for your small fluffy pug to fight all such scary Monsters? No panic! Your faithful doggo will find precious Treasures on its path and increase its Level in order to unlock new Combos, power up its attacks, cure its wounds and that will definitely help him/her save the day!â€¨

The fight goes on until the Heroes are defeated or the Monsters are; first scenario: the game ends.

At the end of each scenario the brave pugs will meet a Pug Merchant so they can buy Treasures or trade their own Energy Cards or loot: collaboration is the key to survive!

Second scenario: the players may go on to the second World and eventually to the third one, the Boss lair.

Bosses have their own special abilities and will represent the hardest enemies for you proud doggos to defeat!

Godspeed you, brave pugs! May the cards be ever in your favor!

—description from the publisher

name.value: ミッキー&フレンズ 5ファイブリンクス (Mickey & Friends 5 Links)
ファインディング・ニモ (Finding NEMO)

item.description:
In the history card game ä¿ºã¯è±ªæ— (Orewa Gozoku) (I, Clansman), you play roles of the lords of ancient Japan and lead your clans for 16 generations -- from the 4th to the 7th Century A.D.. You compete each other in collecting political powers. Victory Points are earned when you contribute to strengthen the kingdom in military, economy and other fields. At the end of the 7th Century, the player with the most VPs is the winner and becomes the highest rank aristocrat in the newborn empire.

The game is played in 16 rounds. Each round, players take turns placing their workers on production buildings in a counterclockwise order, and then buying cards from the market in a clockwise order. When you buy a card, the production buildings you own and the one occupied by your worker in total must produce the resources sufficient for the card's cost. Some cards become your own production buildings, and others provide VPs.

—description from the publisher

The beloved game of quick sketches and hilarious guesses now features three innovative, new ways to play! Mirror, Mirror: trace on one side of the window while your teammate follows along with a marker on the other side; Action: pull your clue, then use the window to act it out; Classic: the Pictionary game you know and love. It also features a large group display, stand, timer, and pen. With 750 clues, the guesses can be just as hilarious as the sketches! For 3 or more players. Ages 8 and older.

A whole new way to play Pictionary
3 ways to play: Action, Mirror Mirror and Classic
Trace along with your teammate or act out your clue
Or play a game of Classic Pictionary
Includes frame display, stand, timer, pen and cards with 750 clues

Sternbild is a roll and move game on a board depicting our solar system and a little bit of what's beyond. Players roll four dice to move to the outer edges and eventually to the center of the galaxy. Certain fields have certain effects, and players can strike each other and send each other back to the center, although pawns which went through that get a bonus during the rest of the game. 
From the outmost field players must roll a sequence of four numbers to reach the target field before being sent back by other players. The board shows names of planets and other orbital objects in many languages.

—user summary

The Earth has become a giant and contaminated dump, ruled by chaos and violence. There is a new law: if a citizen breaks any law (it doesn't matter what law) he will be condemned to prison and executed in 24 hours. With this new law, they try to:

1.- Avoid judgments, lawyers, bureaucracy and prisons.
2.- Make a public show of the execution that prevents future crimes.
3.- Entertain population.

The execution takes place in a fortress called Presidium. Inside it there is a pit called Coliseum Daemonium where several Portals are opened, troughtout those portals appears some hideous blood thirsty creatures. They are quick, lethal and they have an incredible destruction capacity.

Some people claim to the heavens crying that they are opening the gates of hell. But who cares where those creatures come from if the crime rates are descending like never before, and the audience is unbeliable.

You have been judged and will be executed with up to 3 other convicts. You will be provided with a state of the art Xecutor Armour, that is connected to your nervous system and will protect you from the attack of the creatures, and with a L:A:W rifle, the most advance piece of warfare that exist. Besides that you will have 6 energy charges that can be used to power up the armour or the rifle or your own reflexes.

A roof rail system will deploy several crates that have valuable pieces of equipment. This system will deploy explosive barrels too and big cubes that form the Coliseum Daemonium.

If you could destroy 2 portals (or kill the other convicts) a gate will be opened for you, if you reach that exit door your crimes will be redeemed.

But beware, that's not an easy task!
Welcome to the future, welcome to Presidium.

-description from designer

A Series of American Games of War Based Upon Military Principles and Designed for the Assistance Both of Beginners and Advanced Students in Prosecuting the Whole Study of Tactics, Grand Tactics, Strategy, Military History, and the Various Operations of War. Illustrated With Numerous Diagrams. To Which Is Appended a Collection of Studies Upon Military Statistics as Applied to War on a Field Map. By Charles A.L. Totten, First Lieutenant, Fourth United States Artillery.

—description from the publisher

This two volume work was a set of rules designed for simulating battles on the tabletop, in the style of Kriegsspiel. Rules are included for The Minor Tactical Game, The Grand Tactical Game, The Battle Game, and The Advanced Game. Units represent corps. A map scale of 5-10 inches to the mile is recommended.

—user summary

Oktet is a card game in which each player competes in the most riotous way to make a set of eight identical cards and shout "OKTET" out loud.

In the game, players may trade their starting cards once per round and must give a card to other players and bluff each other with "wild cards" to achieve victory.

In the esoteric world of Dalhalla, once you reach the rank of Adhipa there's so many things to do, yet you have to polish your ability to control Vishra. Therefore a mystical method of training was invented, and later on this method became popular even among the youngest of Dalhalla.

This training is Varna, and this game of the mind, each Adhipa tests their mental strength against another Adhipa to conquer the power of Vishra. In Grumantra of Dalhalla: Varna, you can either create or destroy elements of opposing forces by adding more force to your elements. This process works differently for each element, depending on an elemental diagram.

—description from the publisher

One day, the peace in a distant kingdom of Luwak (chivet) is broken by the disappearance of the Raja Luwak (the king of chivet). Each member of the Luwak tribe begins to compete to claim the throne of the Luwak Kingdom.

In Raja Luwak, you dive your way deeper into the kingdom by pressing your luck in dice rolling and gathering materials to outwit other competitors and claim your true worth of the throne of Luwak.

—description from the publisher

In the esoteric world of Dalhalla, there's a hereditary ancient ritual to achieve greater understanding to the mysterious power of Vishra called Mahapatha, a ritual that can be achieved only by sacrificing oneself to the underworld.

In Grumantra of Dalhalla: Mahapatha, fight your way against the dungeon master or become the dungeon master in this turn/action-based strategy board game. Learn new techniques, master your inner strength, and return with your comrades to Dalhalla to master the rank of Adhipa.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Smong is coming! Run to the hill and save yourself.

The peaceful island of Simeuleu is being threatened by Smong, a gigantic water dragon awakened by an earthquake. Make the right decisions to save as many turtles as possible, while waiting for Nabang, The Whale Rider to arrive and turn Smong back to sleep. Be careful for each step you take will also trigger the movement of Smong. At the end of the game, be the bravest and help Nabang in pushing Smong back to the ocean and gain the most victory points to win the game.

Smong is inspired by a folklore from Simeuleu island that warns the natives about the danger of tsunami. By learning about the story since their childhood, the local people of Simeuleu learned about tsunami and the necessary steps to take during an earthquake and incoming tsunami.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Marvel Super Heroes Collector's Club Trading Cards

item.description:
Published by Scholastic Entertainment Inc. in 2006-07 as part of a monthly subscription service, and appears to be a mechanically simple card game with 5 types of cards

 Hero (blue)
 Villain (purple)
 Resist (red)
 Power (green)
 Wild Card (yellow)




There are also Ultimate Villain foil cards that had a slightly different structure than the standard Villain cards.

The game was distributed as fixed packs in each monthly shipment to club members, with a metal tin in the initial shipment. Unfortunately, no copies of the rules are to be found online, so most people who have come across the cards appear to be unable to actually play the game.

Nine centuries ago, there was a young man called Ibn Batutah. He left his homeland to explore the world. After walking the scorching desert, he crossed the sea, then passed through the coldness of the snow. Here's a great adventure throughout history! His great journey was written in a note entitled "Rihla".

A few centuries later, you and your friends discovered Ibn Batutah's journey. Inspired by "Rihla", you decided to trace Ibn Batutah's adventure, and the journey has just begun.

The Ibnu Batutah board game was based on "Rihla" and another journey notes from Ibn Batutah.

item.description:
Winter, 1846. Experience the harsh and fateful journey of America’s favorite cannibals, The Donner Party. Pick up and own the game today… IF YOU DARE!

May the best cannibal win:

Brave your way out of the snowy slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountains and stagger to safety in Fort Sacramento. Collect Fingers Of Meat along the treacherous Emigrant Trail whilst avoiding Toil, Trouble and Doom (and learnin’ a little history along the way). The one who gets to the Fort with the most Meat wins!

—description from the publisher

Baby Boum is a board game in French designed to answer to a popular scientific objective. It was created by five doctoral students and produced by the Nancy student association Big Brother. This game was created by Quentin Dumont, Mickaël Lebdar, Géraud Le Falher, Tania Louis and Camille Paoletti, advised and supervised by Stéphane Goria (researcher at the Mediation Research Centre of the University of Lorraine) and Marie-Laure Lenertz (Communication Officer at the Institute of Genetics and Molecular and Cellular Biology of the University of Strasbourg) as part of a training for doctoral students during the "Science & You" days at the University of Lorraine in Metz in 2015. Using black humour, this game highlights the problem of infertility in some parts of Africa (contrary to stereotypes and other preconceived ideas, research shows the health and social urgency associated with this problem). The scientific elements conveyed by the game are based on the research work undertaken by Emmanuelle Simon (researcher at the Centre de recherche sur les médiations of University of Lorraine).
It is a humorous game in which each player plays a character or a pair of characters whose particular winning conditions and other characteristics are represented on a tablet on which the cards drawn during the game are placed. The game also requires 2 dices.

Take your friends to a journey discovering each other as you never imagined...

Two teams of both boys and girls face embarrassing and exciting challenges to achieve victory. Two decks for different levels of difficulty and naughtiness: one to break the ice and another to get into the heat of the action.

The game has two different set of rules
Each card presents a challenge to the player to be performed alone or with a partner. Accepting a challenge awards the player's team with points, whereas refusing it will decrease the team score.

The cards decide how the two partners should be dressed (or undressed!) and if the partner is to be picked randomly or at player's choice.

The team with the highest score, wins the match!

—description from the designer

Ryan is on a fence bordered by a different color rocket ship on either side. Both players simultaneously slide "power pucks" attempting to hit the target under the bridge. Ryan will move closer to a player's rocket with each successful hit of the target by that player. The winner is the first player who gets Ryan to reach their ship five times.

Enter the dungeon and leave it as first with the most loot. But sadly it isn’t that easy. While building the dungeon card by card, you need to fight against monsters and pass some silly traps.
Raus aus dem Verlies! is an easy card game for the whole family.

Opticall is a strategic bluffing card game.
Players take turns playing six different colors on a central pile until someone is caught bluffing by another player. The final player left in the game becomes the winner.

Like Bull Sh*t/Cheat with intricate strategy.

—description from the publisher

Speak Out Showdown is the electronic 'head to head' mouthpiece challenge game with ridiculous rambling and random interruptions. Players simultaneously try to get their teammates to correctly guess more correct phrases than their opponents, but the electronic interrupter unit's hand randomly determines when it's your turn to speak out and when it's not! One player from each team sits in front of the unit and tries to say different phrases while wearing a speech-inhibiting mouthpiece that keeps their lips open. Their teammates try to guess what they’ve said when the hand is flipped down in front of them, indicating that it’s their turn to talk. The phrases on the cards utilize specific letter combinations that are hard to say without the ability to close their mouth. Cards are collected for correctly guessed phrases. The two players switch so that their partner gets turns saying phrases. After two rounds, the team at the end with the most cards, wins!

—description from the publisher

Get ready for an intense 3-dimensional puzzle game that will bend your mind. In this game you must arrange the blocks to match the "shadows" depicted on the challenge cards. Shadow Blocks contains three levels of difficulty and enough blocks for up to four players.

—description from the publisher

name.value: World At War 85 Core Rules v2.0

item.description:
The World At War 85 series of games (WaW85) are fast-paced, platoon-level simulations of combat during the Third World War. The series’ action begins in 1985, and brings to life the troops, tanks, artillery, and aircraft of that time period, as conflict erupts around the globe.

These Core Rules are designed to be used with every game in the series, and so, once learned, you will be able to play any game in the series. Individual game Volumes (also called Modules, but each is, in fact, a complete standalone game) may add rules for use in that module, and individual scenarios may introduce rules that apply only to that scenario. But the Core Rules remain the same.
When in doubt, Module Rules override the Core Series rules and Scenario Rules (SRs) override both the Core Series and Module Rules.

link.value: World At War 85: Blood and Fury
World At War 85: Storming the Gap
World At War 85: Strike Force Africa
World At War 85: The Untold Battles
World At War 85: When the Lion Roars

item.description:
MeowMeow Mia is a social deduction game where players from two opposing factions are trying to outwit their opponents in the battle of smuggling. The notorious Meowfia is trying to smuggle contrabands to different locations in the city for a good load of fortune. However, the law enforcement has secretly planted its undercover agent in the ranks of the Meowfia with the mission of informing his/her comrades through means of passing secret codes so that the law enforcement can stop the Meowfia’s smuggling attempts. As for the Meowfia, their job is to identify the undercover agent or successfully complete three smuggling attempts to win the game!

Meowmeow Mia is nothing like the ordinary social deduction games because in this game you are communicating with some secret gesture codes! Keep your eyes open and pay attention to every little bit of movement from other players. They might be leaking your smuggling plans under your nose!

item.description:
Lost in Canton is a game that has a revolutionary structure as it uses boards as pages in a book, and the game itself looks like a book.

The game is about a fairy tale in Canton, China. Within the tale, the Dragon fish kids are born and put into human society. They will learn all the wonderful knowledge and every handcraft skill of Canton culture, and eventually go to the Temple Gathering to ascend as a real Chinese Dragon.

During the game, players each act as a newly born Dragon Fish kid that has just landed upon Canton's land. The players need to find different masters to learn the knowledge and handcraft skills. On a player's turn, they can ask any other player a question about the location info of the master. The asked player can answer the truth or use their ability to avoid answering or confuse the asking player. The first player that found their master's location wins.

A hilarious drawing game designed by a psychologist to foster creativity.

Research shows that childhood creativity is on the decline and we should all be concerned. This game is designed to foster creativity through an old-school tabletop game that’s simple, fun and expands your mind. While the decline in childhood creativity was the impetus for designing the game, it is extremely fun with or without kids and promotes creativity in all. To spice things up a bit for adult game nights, there is also an optional Adults Only Expansion pack.

Each round of Starting Lines provides a creative prompt (a category) and a constraint (the starting line). What happens next is creativity. Everyone gets the same simple Starting Line, but inevitably takes it in a completely different directions. You will be surprised by what kids see in a Starting Line and be brought to tears laughing at what your weird friends find. A judge reviews all players drawings and select the one they like the most. That player collects the category card from that round. Play continues until you decide to stop. The player with the most category cards at the end is declared the winner, and of course deemed the most creative.

The game play can be as quick as 15 minutes or can go on for hours. The game is great for large parties. While the game includes enough markers for 6 players, with more markers you can play with as many friends as you can find.

—description from the publisher

MERCATO

Modern day markets offers to their visitors various kind of booths, stores and services.

In Mercato, players buy booths in the market, open new business that influence those booths and attract clients to them.

Mercato is a thinky filler title. It’s a tile placement game based upon Lisboa city building system in which the players pay money to own stalls on the market and special stores next to them to improve their profit and tiles with customers that scores for the matching booths. Mercato is a fast paced game, very straightforward and easy to learn rules with deep tactical choices.

A shroud of darkness has enveloped the long dormant Obsidian Tower. As it begins to creep unto the surrounding area, skirmishes rife with foul creatures are making a once fertile land desolate and it appears that the kingdom is on the brink of war.

The King has confirmed that this malice is an ancient evil - the Witchlord of Agaroth, also known as the Darkbringer - who has taken refuge within the confines of the sable keep. All willing heroes have been summoned to aid in the battle against this villainy.

Ancient tales surface of secrets buried with the kings of old; travelers whisper of mystical light sources which can penetrate the depths of any abyss; and that magical items are capable of exiling any evil but are protected within the depths of dark labyrinths. However, an ominous shadow soars overhead as fire and brimstone erupt upon the horizon …

Will your party be able to fend off vast insurgencies, make it to the Tower alive, and prevail against this ancient evil?

Adventure awaits only the bravest! Gather your party of heroes in a quest to save a kingdom under siege. Discover 3 hidden relics and make it to the Obsidian Tower to defeat the Witchlord before his minions can lay waste to all of the land.

The Obsidian Tower is an exciting fantasy-based co-operative adventure that supports action for as many as six players, ages 12 and up.

—description from the designer

item.description:
Pucket is a frantic dexterity game. Players race each other to clear the pucks from their side of the board by catapulting them through a small hole leading to the other side. Any pucks that arrive on your side must be sent back before you win. The game appeals to anyone with a competitive streak.

—description from the publisher

Fall Classic Baseball brings all of the thrills of managing a big league baseball team to your kitchen table. Call the hit and run, steal a base, is it time to pull the pitcher? All of these decisions are yours to make as you guide your roster towards a pennant. Play today's stars against Hall of Fame greats in what-if match ups. You're in control, so enjoy the show and see if your team can go home with a victory in the Fall Classic.

Each individual batting card is calculated to match the player's stats for that season to within one of the actual number for all of the hitting stats ... singles, doubles, triples, home runs, walks, hit by pitch, and strikeouts.

Each individual pitching card is calculated to match the player's stats for that season in all of the major pitching stats ... hits allowed, walks allowed, home runs allowed, and strikeouts. So, if your star struck out 300 batters that year, the card will produce the same given an even distribution of dice rolls. Also, pitchers are rated for endurance and wild pitches. Even those pitchers with minimal hits and walks allowed can perform to their true abilities in an easy to play format.

Errors are also accurate for each different position played. Also, Infielders are rated for turning the double play, outfielders for assists & runner advances on hits, and catchers for controlling the running game.

Right Hand Path is a single page roll & write game. Collect relics and craft a protective salt circle to keep yourself and your home safe from invading dark and demonic forces. You need a writing utensil and two six-sided dice to play.

Puzzle Dungeon is a solitaire hand management,modular board, set collection game in which you control a monster hunter making their way through a dungeon filled with several types of monsters and their kings.

In Puzzle Dungeon, the player uses the limited cards in their hand and cards they deal into play from a deck to defeat enemies which are dealt randomly each game to form a unique board. Players are limited by the order in which their cards are dealt and the order of the monsters in the dungeon, so a strong strategy is required to win.

Puzzle Dungeon features twenty double-faced monster cards. The front of each monster card features an average monster of that type: a vampire, a goblin, or haunted armor. The back of each monster card depicts that monster as a monster king. There are four of each type of monster. When the third monster of a type is defeated, the fourth is flipped over to the monster king. Monster kings have punishing abilities and a strong effect on the game.

—description from the designer

item.description:
Welcome to The world of modern software design! Two to four players take on the role of competing Chief Scrum Masters in a race to help their SCRUM teams build and deploy the hottest new app idea to market first. SCRUM teams Red Sparrows, Yellow Cranes, Green Owls, and Blue Crows each receive $500K of funding at game start and are able to use their funds to manipulate cards in hand or another player’s tableau. The player that most effectively manages their card draws, resources, and sprint planning actions will come out on top and lead their SCRUM team to tech geek glory!

Scrum: The Card Game is a hand and resource management game with a touch of “take that” which plays in 20-30 minutes. Players compete to get their 6 Product Lifecycle cards down on their tableau first while avoiding software bugs and managing their resources effectively. Money can be spent to manipulate your hand during the “Sprint Planning” phase at the start of a player’s turn and cards such as “Audit” or “Program Blocker!” can be used to ruin another player’s plan. Players will need careful planning, tactics, and a bit of luck to lead your SCRUM teams to modern software fame and fortune!

It’s now a family game with a built in raunchy expansion for adults. You get to draw a scenario, while others respond and generate laughs.

4 decks. 3 of them are used together to form a complete sentence creating just 1 of one million possible scenarios.

The 4th deck is used for responses. One player will read the scenario while the other players respond. The reader will then read the responses out loud to choose their favorite response. The goal of the game is to win 5 scenarios or to just have a good time laughing with your friends. Familiar playing style, but has two ways of being entertained. Through the scenario's as well as the responses. Has a well balanced blend of pure ridiculous to the infamous raunchy card styles.

—description from the publisher

The ancient Huarpes who habited the region of Cuyo performed different competitions to see which tribe was the favorite of the Gods. Of these competitions, the most daring one was mastering the Zonda wind. The most skilled of each tribe spent years practicing to master the aspects of the wind and other elements of nature that surrounded them. With these skills they faced each other in great competitions to obtain the favor of the Gods. Let the Ancestral tournament begin!

The objective of the game is to eliminate the other players, filling their hut with leaves.

—description from the publisher

Los antiguos Huarpes que habitaban la región de Cuyo realizaban distintas competencias para ver que tribu era la preferida de los Dioses. De estas competencias, la más osada era la del dominio del viento Zonda. Los más habilidosos de cada tribu pasaban años practicando hasta lograr dominar los aspectos del viento y de los demás elementos de la naturaleza que los rodeaba. Con estas habilidades se enfrentaban en grandiosas competencias para obtener el favor de los Dioses ¡Que comience el torneo Ancestral!

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Bam-Bam Race is a wacky racing game to see who can get to the finish line and manage to stay there until the end of the round. Follow Bam-Bam and his friends to celebrate Indonesian independence day.

Designed to be a grab-and-play game, Bam-Bam Race is easy to set up. Also, it is easy to learn, so your new friends can jump in and play, but still offer strategies to keep you entertained.

South-America, 1930. The world’s most famous archeologists formed a secret alliance and searched through the whole continent for the most valuable treasures.
It was a success, they collected the artifacts of the Chachapoya indians, blessed and cursed as well.
But when it came to distribute the booty, they couldn’t agree, so with cunning and bluffing they tried to outsmart each other.
Who will take home the most valuable treasures? The toughest, the strongest or the smartest?
Everything depends on timing and the right artifact, because grasp all loose all…it’s easy to leave one’s boots there because of greed.
To make things worse, some uninvited guests (The Triad, and the Secret Service) checked in.

The starting player chooses 3 treasure cards, shows them to the other players, throws away 1 secretly and puts down 1 face down and 1 face up.

The players start bidding on these cards and the winner takes both. Players must bid with cards of the same value - but variable number of cards - and at the end of the round all players get only 1 card.

If someone collects more than one treasure card of the same kind, he/she is eliminated from the game.

The player with the highest score (who is not eliminated) wins the game.

item.description:
While out on patrol on Mars, you were caught in a seismic event, trapping you underground and cutting you off from any rescue. Your only hope now is to dig your way out.

Luckily, your Mars exploration suit comes with some useful terraforming tools that will help you. But it doesn’t have unlimited energy and you might be buried under too much rock to escape.

Still, try not to let that ruin your day.

Below Mars is a small-footprint, variable set-up (for length & difficulty), sci-fi themed pattern-matching Print-and-Play game for one player.

—description from the designer

The zombies are coming! Run for your life ..
The fast running game with the ultimate adrenaline rush! By rolling the dice successfully, you‘ll proceed steadily on the placed course. 
If you are afraid and often save your path, you‘ll risk that the others reach the safe hut in front of you .. Who can do it first?

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher

Game play:
The start field will be laid open first. Then all running fields are placed one after the other in any order (from the start field) as a continuous course, always edge to edge. Finally, the target field is placed to the last running field. The number tokens are mixed loosely and placed open on the running fields as desired (with the yellow side open), so that exactly 1 number token is left each running field.

The player rolls the dice and can move his figure forward (towards the target) as the shown number of the next coaster is rolled. 
After a player has reached a new coaster, he always has the choice to continue (again up to 2 rolls to get to the next coaster) or secure himself on the current coaster. Then the number token will be turned to the red backside and the player must finish his turn immediately. A secured number token is saved forever and applies in the rest of the game for all participating players!

Object of the game: To reach the target field in front of all other players. If there are several players (at the end of a complete round), there are also several winners!


 


Die Zombies kommen! Lauf um Dein Leben ..
Das schnelle Laufspiel mit dem ultimativen Adrenalinkick! Durch erfolgreiches Würfeln kannst Du Dich auf dem gelegten Parkour stetig voranbewegen. Bist Du ängstlich und sicherst Dich oft ab, riskierst Du, dass die anderen vor Dir die sichere Hütte erreichen .. Wer schafft es zuerst?

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: 
Das Startfeld wird als erstes offen ausgelegt. Dann werden alle Lauffelder nacheinander in beliebiger Reihenfolge (vom Startfeld aus) als fortlaufender Parcour angelegt, immer Kante an Kante. 
Abschließend wird das Zielfeld an das letzte Lauffeld angelegt.
Die Zahlenmarker werden lose gemischt und beliebig jeweils offen (mit der gelben Seite oben) auf den Lauffeldern ausgelegt, so dass dann pro Lauffeld genau 1 Zahlenmarker ausliegt.

Der Spieler würfelt und kann mit seiner Spielfigur einen Deckel vorrücken (Richtung Zielfeld), wenn die ausliegende Zahl des nächsten Deckels erwürfelt wird. Nachdem ein Spieler einen neuen Deckel erreicht hat, hat er immer die Wahl fortzufahren (wieder bis zu 2 Würfe, um auf den nächsten Deckel zu kommen) oder sich auf dem jetzigen Deckel abzusichern. Der Zahlenmarker wird dann auf die rote Rückseite gedreht und der Spieler muss sofort seinen Zug beenden.
Ein gesicherter Zahlenmarker bleibt dann für immer gesichert und gilt im weiteren Spielverlauf für alle teilnehmenden Spieler!

Spielziel: Vor allen anderen Spielern das Zielfeld erreichen. Stehen dort (am Ende einer kompletten Runde) mehrere Spieler, gibt es auch mehrere Gewinner!

item.description:
Damned pirate souls want to take possession of you ..
You want to get rid of these soul markers as fast as possible, but also the other players have the same fate. It goes from island to island and the lucky 6 always helps you. All other numbers can have bad consequences. Let the sabers rattle! / ~ based on the classic dice game Zeppelin ~

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher

Game play:
The island coaster with the 6 is selected and placed on the table. The remaining coasters are mixed well and placed one after another open in a circle around the 6. Each player gets all 6 soul tokens in a chosen color.

The player rolls the dice and can place exactly one token on the Islands “1” to “5” according to the rolled number. However, if there is already a token on this island, the player must take this and finish his move immediately. 
Island “6”: On this island, any number of tokens can be placed with a rolled 6.
Special coaster “Skull”: On these islands the limit of only one possible token is lifted. The number of the respective island now shows the maximum number of tokens that can be placed there. If this number is exceeded, all tokens located there must be taken.
Special coaster “Saber”: If players pick up tokens from these islands, the player must additionally also take all possible tokens of the same-color from island “6”.

Object of the game: The players are gradually trying to get rid of all their soul tokens. The game ends immediately if a player places his last soul token. This player wins the game!

—description from the designer

Verdammte Piratenseelen möchten sich Deiner bemächtigen .. 
Du willst möglichst schnell diese Seelenmarker loswerden, aber auch die anderen Spieler haben das gleiche Schicksal. Es geht von Insel zu Insel und die glücksbringende 6 hilft Dir immer. Alle anderen Zahlen können böse Folgen haben. Lasst die Säbel rasseln! / ~ basierend auf dem Würfelklassiker Zeppelin ~

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: 
Der Inseldeckel mit der 6 wird aussortiert und mittig auf dem Tisch ausgelegt. Die restlichen Bierdeckel werden gut gemischt und nacheinander offen in Kreisform um die 6 ausgelegt. Jeder Spieler bekommt alle 6 Seelenmarker in einer gewählten Farbe.

Der Spieler würfelt und kann auf den Inseln „1“ bis „5“ entsprechend der gewürfelten Zahl genau einen Marker ablegen. Ist allerdings dort auf dieser Insel schon ein Marker vorhanden, muss der Spieler diesen aufnehmen und seinen Zug sofort beenden.
Insel „6“: Auf dieser Insel können beliebig viele Marker mit einer erwürfelten 6 abgelegt werden.
Sonderdeckel „Schädel“: Auf diesen Inseln ist das Limit von nur einem legbaren Marker aufgehoben. Die Zahl der jeweiligen Insel zeigt jetzt die maximale Anzahl der dort ablegbaren Marker. Wird diese Zahl dann überschritten, müssen alle dort liegenden Marker aufgenommen werden. 
Sonderdeckel „Säbel“: Wird von diesen Inseln Marker aufgenommen, muss der Spieler zusätzlich alle gleichfarbigen möglichen Marker der Insel „6“ mitaufnehmen.

Spielziel: Die Spieler versuchen nach und nach alle ihre Seelenmarker loszuwerden. Das Spiel endet sofort sobald ein Spieler seinen letzten Seelenmarker ablegt; dieser Spieler gewinnt das Spiel!

—description from the designer (German)

item.description:
If you have a dark sense of humor and occasionally find Cards Against Humanity a little too tame, this is the naughty expansion set you've been waiting for.

Guards Against Insanity Asylum Pack takes your Cards Against Humanity experience to a darker, more uncomfortable place.

The Asylum Pack consists of 448 naughty cards; 98 black question cards & 350 white answer cards.

The Asylum Pack can be played as a stand-alone game, however, it's more fun when combined with Cards Against Humanity and CAH expansions.

ADULT HUMOUR: Guards Against Insanity contains naughty adult humour. So, if you or your friends are easily offended, this probably isn't the right product for you.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume One (unofficial expansion for Cards Against Humanity)

name.value: Profanity: A Card Game For Smutty People

item.description:
Profanity is a card game for smutty people. If you enjoy reading some of the really messed up stuff on Urban Dictionary, this is the game for you...

That's because you're going to be creating your own deeply disturbing phrases and giving everyone a glimpse inside that warped mind of yours.

How To Play

The smuttiest person begins the game as the Judge. The Judge chooses a starting word and places it face up in the middle of the table.

Players now choose one card from their hand to pair with the Judge's card.

You may combine your card with the Judge's in any order you wish. For example, if the Judge's card was Swallow, the card 'Dutch' could be used to make the phrase 'Dutch Swallow' or 'Swallow Dutch'.

Once a player has announced what their chosen phrase is, they may provide their own twisted definition.

Profanity is as dirty as you decide to make it, however due to the adult nature of the content, we recommend that Profanity is played by guys and girls who are 17+ years of age.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In this game you try to collect families.

The game consists of 40 cards divided into eight families of five. Each player receives six cards. The rest go in a pile.
On your turn you will ask another player for a card from a specific family. You must already hold at least one card from this family. If you get a card, your turn continues and you can ask again (same or other player). If the asked player does not have a card from the family, your turn ends and you draw a card from the pile (until it is empty).

This game is essentially Go Fish, but played with a custom deck.

A balancing game with a "platter" suspended from a gallows.
On your turn you need to place a piece on the "platter". A die will determine which colour piece to place. The pieces come in three sizes worth 1, 2, or 3 points. If you succeed in placing the piece without pieces falling off, you get the points for the piece. If you fail, you get no points.

Play for a predetermined number of rounds. Most points wins.

Corbach 1760 is a game for two players based on the battle of the same name, fought on 10 July 1760 during the Seven Years' War.
Corbach was the first battle of the campaign of 1760.

One player controls the French Army under the command of Saint-Germain and Victor-François, 2nd duc de Broglie marshal of France.
The other controlls the Allied or “Observation” Army under the Erbprinz of Brunswick and Ferdinand, duke of Brunswick.

item.description:
Oak & Iron is a 1/600th scale naval game set in the age of piracy, imperial expansion, and above all, fighting sail. It allows players to recreate battles between small fleets and squadrons of armed sailing ships. The game is designed to be simple and intuitive while also challenging players by providing significant tactical depth, being true to the theme and tactics of the period, and supplying significant flavor for the various factions represented in the game.

The game can be played with up to six players when playing at fleet scale. Two teams of three players each, each player controlling one of more squadrons.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
A solo game requiring the lone survivor of a space mission to gather up equipment on the space ship to make the journey home by escape pod before the oxygen is depleted within the space ship.

Using up to 3 actions, the player moves throughout the spaceship picking up equipment and solving issues that arise throughout the game. Moving through the spaceship reveals equipment found in the spaceship. The spaceship is represented by cards stacked representing the different rooms of the spaceship.

As the the player completes a turn, they draw a card from the Oxygen Levels deck to represent the depleting oxygen supply within the spaceship. The difficulty level can be adjusted by changing the amount of cards within the Oxygen Levels deck.

The base game includes 4 different scenarios that explain what equipment and other requirements are needed to be meet before safely escaping through the Escape Pod.

"Get out while you can still breathe!"

—description from the publisher

This is a game about around-the-world flight using a map showing the North Pole in the middle. Nominally there's an actual race, although this isn't really consistent with the leisurely sightseeing described in many events and use of contemporary passenger airliners. With its flavour texts and other enclosed information, the game is clearly meant to promote geographical knowledge as well as interest in commercial aviation.

Starting from Stockholm, each player colour has its own path connecting to the main circuit around the world. The spaces on the individual and common paths all have flavour texts, game instructions and/or point gains or losses associated with them. This information is found in player folders and the rules booklet, respectively.

Although most of the time players have no say in what happens, some spaces allow choices such as whether to gain a few points or move a step forward, and in a few spots, players are given small tasks such as drawing a llama, using an enclosed nomogram to calculate travel time, or explaining the significance of the International Date Line, which may gain or lose points as arbitrarily judged by an impartial scorekeeper (termed Traffic Controller) and/or the other players.

In addition to points gained from passing by or stopping in various locations, players also gain points based on the order in which they return to Stockholm. The player with the most total points is the winner. A variant to play the game purely as a race with no scorekeeping is also suggested.

Although only six players can fly planes, the rules include the role of scorekeeper in the player count.

ABA stands for AB Aerotransport, a Swedish airline which was folded into SAS just a few years after the publication of the game. Copies exist with just an ABA sticker on the cover or with ABA and SAS stickers; the contents otherwise seem identical.

—description from the publisher game submitter

Freshwater Fly is the second standalone game in a series from designer Brian Suhre that integrates modern game mechanics with the surprisingly rich and uniquely refreshing world of angling. In Freshwater Fly you will encounter a rushing mountain stream teaming with fish, armed solely with a rod, reel and selection of flies. To catch fish and earn valuable achievement points you will need to carefully perform a series of tactical maneuvers while executing a deliberate and evolving strategy.

Begin by examining the ever-changing hatch in the current, and tie a fly to match your target fish at just the right time and turn of the river. Then choose to cast upstream to drift your fly with the current and gain extra bites on your line, or push your luck with a pinpointed cast for the perfect catch. In either case, it is wise to cast near rocks to boost your skill and uncover new fishing techniques, while keeping your supply of finesse charged for the next challenge. Your rondel reel, which physically spins, provides you different bonuses as you draw in your line, depending on how aggressively you choose to fight the fish you've hooked. Applying drag, for instance, will negate the fish's strength, but leveraging your momentum could provide you a unique action to set you up perfectly for your next cast.

At its core, Freshwater Fly is a dice drafting and set collecting game, with elements of creative puzzle solving and pushing your luck. Each turn you select one die from the dice pool and assign it an action that relates to the particular fishing maneuver you want to take. Higher valued dice typically earn you more powerful actions, but accumulating lower dice totals can earn you free turns. The dice you select will also unlock or multiply various bonus actions you can use to solve the most stringent fishing puzzles in unique and rewarding ways.

The sets of fish and flies you collect will help you achieve personal and common goals, but to obtain victory you must focus on those goals which overlap in the most valuable ways, while not falling behind in your total fish count. The game ends when a single player catches a seventh fish, achievement points are awarded, and the winner is declared.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
GAME OF STRATEGY. A pattern card can win a fish for your octopus. But be careful ! If you don't know when to stop, you could lose all your fish...

—description from the publisher

Bubble is a press-your-luck game for children. Collect fishes by drawing cards, recognize the pattern, see if you already have it or not, and take a fish to add it to your collection. The trick is, you have to know when to stop, because some cards will make one, or all of your fishes gone! Some other cards will allow you to steal fishes from other players if they have it on their octopus.

The first player to get all of the 5 fishes on their octopus wins the game.

—user summary

In the famous little town of Bergues in north France, you move your guard around the city wall following one of the two paths after placing some pavements. Your guard needs to finish his move on a door of his fortress to win. Be careful as you are one of four guards on the way to that door! Remember those pavements side and choose the right path to succeed.

—description from the publisher

Wavelength is a social guessing game where two teams compete to read each other's minds. Teams take turns rotating a dial to where they think a hidden bullseye is located on a spectrum. One of the players on your team — the Psychic — knows exactly where the bullseye is, but can only get your team to guess by:

(1) Drawing a card with a pair of binaries on it, such as: Job - Career, Rough - Smooth, Fantasy - Sci-Fi, Sad Song - Happy Song, etc....

(2) Giving a clue that is *conceptually* where the bullseye is located between those two binaries.

For example, if the card this round is HOT - COLD, the Psychic’s clue needs to be on the spectrum between extremely hot on the far left side to extremely cold on the far right side.

After the Psychic gives their clue, your team discusses where they think the bullseye is located and turns the dial to that location on that spectrum.

The closer to the center of the bullseye you guess, the more points your team scores!

—description from the designer
